info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 12:05AM CDT until April 22 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, Jasper, Lawrence, McDonald and Newton.
* WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1202 AM CDT, River gauges and road closure reports show flooding in the area. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Several inches of rain have fallen over the weekend. - This includes the following low water crossings... Shoal Creek at Farm Road 2110, North Indian Creek at Orchid Drive, Butler Creek at Kings Highway, Center Creek at Azalea Drive, Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road, Flat Creek at Highway C and Big Sugar Creek at Buzzard Glory Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Joplin, Carthage, Neosho, Monett, Aurora, Mount Vernon, Cassville, Pineville, Webb City, Carl Junction, Galena, Oronogo, Seneca, Marionville, Granby, Anderson, Carterville, Noel, Duquesne, Sarcoxie, Pierce City, Goodman, Duenweg, Purdy, South West City, Jasper, Diamond, Seligman, Exeter, Miller, Wheaton, Leawood, Silver Creek, Verona, Alba, Washburn, Lanagan, Purcell, Fairview and Shoal Creek Drive. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT TUESDAY

area.areaDesc: Barry, MO; Jasper, MO; Lawrence, MO; McDonald, MO; Newton, MO
